oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Henry L. Douglass, 1981 November 11, excerpt 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville doctor and urologist Henry L. Douglass, conducted on 11 November 1981 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Douglass describes Madison, Tennessee, at the turn of the twentieth century, including churches, buildings, businesses, the railroad station, and the "century party." The complete interview, as well an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Douglass, Henry L., 1891-1990--Interviews
